text: hi guys
angel today I'm going to show you how to
make a quick and easy vegetable stir-fry
using a chart now if you haven't heard
of HOF or it's sometimes known as a
Taiwanese lettuce and a Mandarin we call
this a Thai now it kind of looks like a
romaine lettuce with longer leaves and
stems and taste wise it tastes similar
to I would say a butter lettuce but the
stems are super crisp and crunchy and
it's got a mild bitterness to it which
is really great for this vegetable
stir-fry it's very unique tasting so
with that let's get started for this
recipe we'll just need a few simple
ingredients I recommend starting with
two stalks of a choy per person and
we'll need a couple cloves of garlic it
all depends on how much garlic you like
but I like more and optional but instead
of water I like to use chicken stock so
I've got a couple tablespoons of chicken
stock here and that'll just make the
vegetable stir-fry a bit more savoury
and give it a bit more depth making it
extra tasty and finally sea salt first
start by peeling and slicing your garlic
I like to slice my garlic thin but you
can also use minced or chopped garlic
instead next cut up your a choy into
four inch sections and make sure to
rinse and wash them thoroughly before
cooking when everything's ready and
prepped now we can cook I'm preheating
my wok over medium-low heat and using
just a bit of oil before adding the
garlic stir fry the garlic for a few
seconds to release the flavors and then
add in your a choy
after that it's time to add in your
chicken stock or water to help the
cooking process at this time
turn up the heat to high which will help
cook the veggies faster making them
super crisp you'll only need a stir fry
for two to three minutes total as these
vegetables will cook quickly
finally add and mix in some sea salt to
taste before serving
so this is how you make Taiwanese a Choi
it's super quick and easy to make and on
the weeknights I can usually make this
in under 10 minutes so it makes for a
great weeknight stir fry so with that it
is now time for the taste test I don't
know if you guys can hear that but the
super crunchy and crisp very light
tasting healthy and delicious I hope you
guys enjoyed this video if you're
interested in other vegetable stir-fry
recipes I've got a restaurant style baby
bok choy video tutorial that I will post
a link to thank you guys so much for
watching and I will see you guys next
time bye
